text:
About 8,88,997 children and adolescents in the age group of 1 to 19 in the district would be given the albandezole tablets on February 10 on the occasion of National De-worming Day, Collector K.S. Palanisamy said in a press release. The tablets will be distributed to about 1,87,547 children in the age group of 1 to 5 through the Anganwadis and about 7,01,450 children and among adolescents in the age group of six to 19 through the schools. Apart from this, village health nurses and anganwadi workers would visit door-to-door to bring out-of-school children to the anganwadi centres and distribute the tablets. All necessary arrangements have been made for the distribution of the tablets.

SSLC hall tickets

Private candidates who had applied to appear for the March 2016 SSLC examinations can download their hall tickets from the websitewww.tndge.infrom February8, V.Murugan, Regional Deputy Director of Government Examinations, Tiruchi, said in a press release. The candidates can clink the link ‘SSLC Exam March 2016 – Private Candidate- Hall Ticket Printout,’ at the website to download the hall tickets by providing their application numbers and date of birth, he said.
title: De-worming tablets
